text: The 2004 Russian Premier League (Russian: Чемпионат России по футболу 2004, Chempionat Rossii po futbolu 2004) was the 3rd Russian Premier League season, and the 13th top division football tournament. It was played from 12 March to 12 November 2004. Lokomotiv Moscow won their 2nd title, and Aleksandr Kerzhakov was the top scorer with 18 goals. == Table == Team Qualification or relegation 1 Lokomotiv Moscow (C) 30 18 7 5 44 19 +25 61 2005–06 UEFA Champions League Second qualifying round 2 CSKA Moscow 30 17 9 4 53 22 +31 60 UEFA Cup 2005–06 First round 3 Krylia Sovetov Samara 30 17 5 8 50 41 +9 56 UEFA Cup 2005–06 Second qualifying round 4 Zenit St Petersburg 30 17 5 8 55 37 +18 56 UEFA Cup 2005–06 Second qualifying round 5 Torpedo Moscow 30 16 6 8 53 37 +16 54 6 Shinnik Yaroslavl 30 12 8 10 29 29 0 44 7 Saturn Ramenskoye 30 10 11 9 37 30 +7 41 8 Spartak Moscow 30 11 7 12 43 44 −1 40 9 Moscow 30 10 10 10 38 39 −1 40 10 Rubin Kazan 30 7 12 11 32 31 +1 33 11 Amkar Perm 30 6 12 12 27 42 −15 30 12 Rostov 30 7 8 15 28 42 −14 29 13 Dynamo Moscow 30 6 11 13 27 38 −11 29 14 Spartak Vladikavkaz 30 7 7 16 28 52 −24 28 15 Kuban Krasnodar 30 6 10 14 26 42 −16 28 Relegation to Russian First Division 16 Rotor Volgograd 30 4 10 16 28 53 −25 22 Relegation to Russian First Division == Statistics == === Top goalscorers === 18 goals * Aleksandr Kerzhakov (Zenit St Petersburg) 17 goals * Andrei Karyaka (Krylia Sovetov Samara) 15 goals * Aleksandr Panov (Torpedo Moscow) * Dmitri Sychev (Lokomotiv Moscow) 10 goals * Héctor Bracamonte (Moscow) * Roman Pavlyuchenko (Spartak Moscow) * Oleksandr Spivak (Zenit St Petersburg) * Valery Yesipov (Rotor Volgograd) == Other websites == * RSSSF Category:2004 in European football Category:Russian Premier League Category:2000s in Russian sport
